com.pyramidacceptors.ptalk.api

Interface ISocket


  • public interface ISocket
    This interface describes the methods made available to implementers
    of the socket. Sockets are used to transport data between a master and
    a slave. A Socket handles all handshaking and controls the flow of data.

    In the future this will be implemented for other interfaces such as
    ccTalk.

    Since:
    1.0.0.0
    See Also:
    PyramidPort, ICommDevice

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      byte[] generateCommand()
      Acts as the transport layer of for the communication.
      int getMaxPacketRespSize()
      Get the maximum size packet we would RECEIVE from a slave

      E.g.
      PTalkEvent parseResponse(byte[] bytes)

    • Method Detail

      • generateCommand

        byte[] generateCommand()
        Acts as the transport layer of for the communication. This is
        responsible for generating and parsing all packets between master
        and slave according to the protocol.
        Returns:
        byte[] form of message intended for slave

      • parseResponse

        PTalkEvent parseResponse(byte[] bytes)
        Parse the message according to the protocol and set the
        appropriate state flags. The returned value is a PTalkEvent
        that can be returned directly to client code for parsing or
        passed off to an event filter for further refining.
        Parameters:
        bytes - byte array response to parse
        Returns:
        new PTalkEvent packed with parsed response data

      • getMaxPacketRespSize

        int getMaxPacketRespSize()
        Get the maximum size packet we would RECEIVE from a slave

        E.g. RS-232 would be 11 (bytes)

        Returns:
        Integer Maximum packet size
